review: Before I start, the Chromecast works great if it's what you want.  I found no bugs while operating it,  and because it is HDMI-CEC capable,  all I need to do is click cast to Chromecast on my phone,  and then it turns on my TV,  surround sound,  and changes to the appropriate source.  However, if you do research on what the Chromecast is actually capable of,  this is where the review comes in.  There is no kind of UI on the actual Chromecast,  and the only way to control it is with your phone,  computer,  or tablet.  That is really annoying when you are trying to go to sleep with it on,  and it has no sleep yet to turn off during the night.  Also,  because it runs through your phone or other device,  there are only a certain number of apps that work smoothly with Chromecast.  You can use the screen mirror,  but it is extremely laggy with a lot of bugs.I would not purchase this again,  but I would consider buying something like the Nexus Player,  Kindle Fire TV Stick,  or a Roku.
